DOC.brief_summary: This study will estimate the incidence of hypothyroidism in a pediatric population of children under age 4, based on data from the US-based Kaiser Permanente Northern California database, which were exposed to iodinated contrast agent through having a diagnostic procedure.
DOC.brief_title: Iodinated Contrast Agents and Risk of Hypothyroidism in Young Children in the United States
DOC.criteria: Children under age 4 in the Kaiser Permanente Northern California (KPNC) database, who had a diagnostic procedure with an iodinated contrast agent. Participants should be member of the KPNC for at least 3 months before the iodinated contrast exposure, except where the child is under 3 months of age at time of initial exposure, and 2 weeks after the exposure. Diagnosis of hypothyroid any time prior to the iodine contrast exposure. Lab values for low thyroid (TSH > 5 mU/L for children) any time before the exposure Thyroid replacement therapy, Hashimoto thyroiditis, or congenital hypothyroidism any time prior to exposure.
